title: 108_s2233
content: The Act may be cited as the "Environmental Research Enhancement Act" and pertains to Environmental Protection Agency research activities. The Environmental Research, Development, and Demonstration Authorization Act of 1979 is amended to establish the position of Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency, appointed by the President with Senate approval. The President appoints the Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency with Senate approval. Recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences, National Academy of Engineering, and Science Advisory Board are considered for the appointment. The Deputy Administrator oversees coordination of science and technology matters. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency is responsible for coordinating and overseeing various scientific and technical activities within the agency, including the Office of Research and Development, the Office of Environmental Information, the Science Advisory Board, the Science Policy Council, and activities in the regulatory program and regional offices. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology at the Environmental Protection Agency is responsible for overseeing scientific and technical activities, including identifying important scientific issues and developing an agency-wide strategy for acquiring and disseminating necessary information. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology at the Environmental Protection Agency is responsible for identifying and defining scientific issues, developing an agency-wide strategy for acquiring and disseminating scientific information, and ensuring complex scientific outreach and communication needs are met. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology at the Environmental Protection Agency is responsible for ensuring that the complex scientific outreach and communication needs of the Agency are met, including reaching out to the broader scientific community for relevant knowledge. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology at the Environmental Protection Agency is responsible for coordinating scientific quality-assurance and peer-review activities, ensuring appropriate scientific information is used in decision-making, and certifying to the Administrator that these processes are in place. The Assistant Administrator for Research and Development ensures that scientific information used in regulatory decisions is valid, characterized in terms of uncertainty, and appropriately applied. The Assistant Administrator for Research and Development is appointed for a 6-year term, regardless of other laws. This applies to appointments made after the enactment of this subsection. Additionally, a program for senior research appointments in Office of Research and Development Laboratories will be established in consultation with the Science Advisory Board and the Board of Scientific Counselors. The Office will establish a program to recruit senior researchers with distinguished achievements in environmental research. Awards will be given to support research in rapidly advancing areas related to the Agency's mission. The Office will make awards to senior researchers to support research in rapidly advancing areas related to the Agency's mission and to train junior researchers with exceptional promise. Selection procedures will be established, including consultation with the Science Advisory Board and the Board of Scientific Counselors. The Office will establish selection procedures for award recipients, consult with advisory boards, award grants for a 5-year period, appoint senior researchers to each laboratory, and authorize necessary appropriations for research activities. The Office will appoint not fewer than 1 senior researcher and authorize necessary appropriations for research activities. The Office will also empower research managers to make decisions at the lowest appropriate level. The Office aims to empower research managers to make decisions at the lowest appropriate level, maintain a balance between core and problem-driven research, develop strategies for acquiring research from various sources, and improve decision-making transparency. The Office for research aims to improve decision-making processes by establishing priorities, making assignments, and allocating funds. The Administrator of the Agency is tasked with increasing efforts to disseminate research products and ongoing projects actively. The Administrator of the Agency is responsible for increasing efforts to disseminate research products and projects, explaining their significance, and assisting others in applying the results. Additionally, the Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology is directed to expand the science inventory of the Agency. The Administrator is responsible for disseminating research products and projects, while the Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology is tasked with expanding the science inventory of the Agency by documenting and publishing detailed information on scientific activities conducted by Agency units. This includes project goals, milestones, schedules, principal investigators, project managers, and allocations of staff and financial resources. The Agency aims to document scientific activities, including project details, staff allocations, and financial resources. This information will be used to coordinate activities through the science planning process and improve peer-review policies. The position of Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is redesignated as the position of "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency." This change aims to ensure greater independence of peer reviews from the control of program managers. The position of Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is now the "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency." This change also affects the Executive Schedule Level III. The Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is now the Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency, affecting the Executive Schedule Level III.
